comments.body: Any way to type this? I'm not familiar with the react typings but it looks like they use `Mixin<P, S>` for the type of a mixin.

There is no way that such typing can be useful. Because P and S will have to be any. I tried typing these 2 but there are two things to consider:

1. react mixins are on their way out of the ecosystem.
2. typing them is useless. since it's impossible to implicitly add type information to a class created by `createClass`. React doesn't even support mixins with es2015 classes.

I only put these here for completeness.
Why remove the ? handles some edge cases and was added explicitely

Edge cases like? Could you look into the attached [source code](https://github.com/Olical/react-faux-dom/blob/master/lib/_withFauxDOM.js)?

I honestly haven't found a way to not pass props using higher order component as it's just always passed in there as a prop. Mixins were removed with one of the previous releases.
@cleverguy25 - could you answer my question? ðŸ˜„
